info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 4:38PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Salt Lake County through 515 PM MDT... At 437 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bingham Canyon Mine, or 8 miles south of West Valley City, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Salt Lake City, West Valley City, Murray, West Jordan, Taylorsville, South Jordan, Riverton, Midvale, Holladay, South Salt Lake, Herriman, Millcreek, Kearns, Magna, Bingham Canyon Mine, Oquirrh, East Millcreek, Canyon Rim, Cottonwood West and Mount Olympus. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 297 and 306. Interstate 80 in Utah between mile markers 109 and 116, and between mile markers 123 and 128. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
